content.user_title: Create accessible UI with ShadCN patterns
content.value_statement: Building accessible React components requires understanding ShadCN patterns and Radix UI primitives. This skill provides best practices for implementing accessible modals, forms, and other components using TailwindCSS and November 2025 standards.
actual_capabilities: Enforce Button component variants and size patterns
Implement accessible Dialog and Modal components
Create forms with React Hook Form and Zod validation
Apply Server vs Client component patterns
Use TailwindCSS utility classes with cn() helper
Add keyboard navigation and screen reader support
limitations: Does not install or modify ShadCN components in your project
Does not generate full application code or project structure
Requires existing ShadCN installation to apply patterns

use_cases.title: Component standardization
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow consistent ShadCN patterns for buttons, dialogs, and forms.

use_cases.title: Form validation patterns
use_cases.description: Implement type-safe forms using React Hook Form with Zod schemas and accessible error handling.

use_cases.title: WCAG compliance
use_cases.description: Build components that meet WCAG 2.1 AA requirements with proper ARIA labels and focus management.

prompt_templates.title: Create button component
prompt_templates.scenario: Need a new button with proper variants
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Button component using ShadCN patterns. Include default, destructive, outline, ghost, and link variants with default, small, large, and icon sizes.

prompt_templates.title: Build accessible modal
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a Dialog component with DialogHeader, DialogTitle, and DialogDescription. Use DialogTrigger with asChild for proper focus management.

prompt_templates.title: Form with validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a login form using ShadCN Form components with React Hook Form and Zod validation. Include email and password fields with error messages.

prompt_templates.title: Server vs client patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain when to use Server Components vs Client Components for ShadCN components. Show examples of both patterns including use client directive usage.

output_examples.input: Create a delete confirmation dialog with ShadCN patterns

best_practices: Always use DialogTrigger with asChild to avoid nested button elements
Define Zod schemas for form validation before implementing form components
Apply dark mode classes using TailwindCSS dark: prefix for theming
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding colors instead of using built-in variant props
Do not skip DialogHeader or DialogTitle components
Do not use uncontrolled forms without validation in production

faq.question: Which React frameworks work with ShadCN UI?
faq.answer: ShadCN UI works with Next.js 15 App Router, Remix, Vite, and Astro. All examples support Server and Client Components.

faq.question: Does this skill install components for me?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides best practices patterns. Use npx shadcn@latest add command to install components in your project.

faq.question: Can I use ShadCN UI without TailwindCSS?
faq.answer: ShadCN UI is designed for TailwindCSS. Alternative CSS solutions require significant customization and are not recommended.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network calls. Your project data is never accessed.

faq.question: Why are my dialogs not closing on Escape key?
faq.answer: ShadCN Dialog handles Escape automatically. If it fails, ensure you are not preventing event propagation in parent elements.

faq.question: How is ShadCN UI different from other component libraries?
faq.answer: ShadCN UI copies component code to your project rather than installing npm packages. You own and fully customize the code.
